intro: Bakerella gonoclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bakerella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Bakerella gonoclada is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
